column3: How about giving `0x1f` a name e.g. `SIGHASH_MASK` and use it in other places anywhere either value is used? The only other use I see is in `IsDefinedHashtypeSignature`.
@jl2012 Sorry to be unclear, was referring to `~SIGHASH_ANYONECANPAY`
(& ~SIGHASH_ANYONECANPAY) has no consensus meaning. Not sure why it was used here in the first place
I would like to see it named `SIGHASH_MASK` and then placed as a constant some where as well.\n\nutack 283b96b
@Christewart added a commit to define SIGHASH_MASK. I'm fine with or without that.\n\n@MarcoFalke does it need a _Validation_ tag?
re-utack b84c353 . Don't we have a Policy label?
@Empact that one is correct. It makes only 6 types of SIGHASH standard: 1, 2, 3, 0x81, 0x82, 0x83
